column1: Niacin is a type of B vitamin.
A deficiency of niacin causes pellagra.

The symptoms include: - Digestive problems - Inflamed skin - Mental impairment Large doses of niacin can cause: - Increased blood sugar (glucose) level - Liver damage - Peptic ulcers - Skin rashes Even normal doses can be associated with feeling warmth, redness, itching or tingling of the face, neck, arms or upper chest.
New forms of nicotinic acid reduce this side effect.
Nicotinamide does not cause these side effects.
